results.title: Sales Development Manager
results.description:
The Rev team is growing and we need an SDR Manager to help scale a grow our SDR team. You’ll be working with SDRs to develop a qualified pipeline through a combination of account-based programs, inbound lead development, and outbound prospecting. You will define, iterate on, and implement processes to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the team.

As a team-oriented management professional, you will be working cross-functionally with critical members of the Sales, Marketing, and Product.

Now, let’s get to selling.


Role Responsibilities
  • Work as the intersection between Marketing and Sales to create strategic programs to create market demand
  • Lead a team of SDRs/ BDRs to create qualified opportunities for the sales team
  • Take on operational and administrative tasks to help the SDR/BDR team perform and exceed expectations. Keep CRM clean and up-to-date. Manage tasks statuses and day-to-day SDR activity
  • Onboard and train members of the SDR/BDR team. Standardize and optimize training programs
  • Ensure SDR Team members improve performance and abilities over time by providing coaching and feedback
  • Work in collaboration with Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success to develop effective messaging to develop qualified pipeline
About You:
  • 2+ years of management experience
  • Demonstrated ability to coach, train & motivate a team
  • Consistent proven track record of over-achievement of quota expectations
  • Deep understanding of inbound & outbound prospecting methodology in all market segments
  • Outstanding communication, organizational and time-management skills
  • Proven analytical skills and ability to communicate information effectively to the team
  • Outstanding presentation, verbal and written communication skills
  • Strategic thinker and self-starter
About Vitally:

Vitally is a Customer Success platform built for strategic and proactive CS teams looking to easily prevent churn and retain (and identify) their best customers. Some of the best CS teams at companies like Zapier, Segment, and Productboard trust Vitally to unify their customer data. We make it possible with our powerful analytics dashboards, intuitive automations, and project management tools that all together make their customer data collaborative, measurable, and actionable for all key stakeholders-- from CSMs to CEOs.

We’re a high-growth, VC-backed startup who, at the end of the day, are looking to onboard people who want to have a profound impact on both the business and their own career. How? Working together to build the future of Customer Success.

If you get excited about ownership, autonomy, impact, and quality output -- then we’re excited about you. We’re not here to hold your hand, but we’re here to build a great product together.


Benefits & Culture:
  • Competitive Salary: We offer a competitive salary given both your experience as well as location (we know some places cost a lot to live!) The compensation band for this role starts at $140,000 base and increases based on candidate's skillset, and seniority.
  • Commission: 30% of your total On-Target Earnings (OTE) will be tied to performance against your teams goals
  • Equity: We want every team member invested in the company’s success and are happy to be generous with equity.
  • Benefits:
    • 100% of health/dental/vision insurance premiums covered by us for you, your partner, and your dependents.
    • 401k with a company match.
    • Commuter benefits.
    • Unlimited PTO with a minimum we require you to take off. Please relax and recharge!
    • Flexible work hours and work-from-home policy.
    • WFH stipend to ensure your work environment meets your standards wit (i.e. laptop, monitor, etc).
    • Education stipend.
  • Culture: We are committed to a productive and respectful work environment. Culturally, the team is extremely friendly, fun, hard-working, intelligent, and mature. That said, while we're young and scrappy as a team, we don't believe in building a startup cult. We like each other, we support each other, we're a focused team that busts our asses at work, and we enjoy hanging out from time to time-- but we enjoy having our own lives outside of Vitally.
  • Career path: Not only will you learn a ton in this role, but since we're a small team, there will be plenty of promotion and growth opportunities ahead.

results.title: Enterprise Software Sales Consultant
results.description:
Company Description

This is a unique opportunity to get on executive team of a fast-growing AI start-up. The company is founded by a Stanford professor and led by recognized thought leaders in Industrial AI and aerospace analytics.

Our main product is enterprise SaaS for maintenance supply chain in aircraft fleets. The product is built around proprietary Analytics Engines and allows easy customer data integrations.

The company won substantial repeat business from US Air Force Sustainment Operations over last several years. We looking to leverage our military customer successes into substantial growth in the short term, and an M&A exit in the medium term (a couple of years). We are a technology leader in a fast-growing segment of Industrial AI for supply chain and the probability of fast win is very high.



Job Description

We are looking for a Sales Executive with strong experience selling enterprise software in the Aviation/ Airlines industry directly and through partnerships/channels. In addition to Aviation/ Airlines, your clients may have included aerospace OEMs, MRO companies, IT vendors who sell to aerospace, etc.

You will be working with C-level executives of the clients and partners, as well as with our leadership team and be responsible for negotiating complex agreements, closing deals, and growing accounts.



Qualifications
  • At least 5 years of experience selling enterprise software in the Aviation/ Airlines industry including major accounts sales.
  • Proven experience closing deals larger than $1-2M.
  • Experience working with C-level leaders
  • Experience with AI or Advanced Analytics business.
  • Experience or strong interest in working at a start-up company and sharing its success
  • Experience with M&A deals is a plus.
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills.
  • Bachelor’s degree.
  • US Citizenship
  • Ability to travel as needed


Additional Information
  • All candidates must be US Citizens.
  • This is a part-time position (hourly rate plus generous commissions)
  • This is a remote position. You can live anywhere in the USA. Proximity to San Francisco Bay Area or Atlanta, GA is a plus.

results.title: (Senior) Account Executive
results.description:
(Senior) Account Executive DACH
80-100% | immediately | remote in Switzerland

 

About Exeon:

Exeon Analytics AG is a Swiss cyber tech company specialising in the protection of IT and OT networks through AI-driven security analytics. Our Network Detection & Response (NDR) platform ExeonTrace allows companies to monitor corporate networks, immediately detect cyber threats and thus effectively protect their organisation’s IT landscape - quickly, reliably, and completely hardware-free. The self-learning algorithms for detecting anomalies in network activity were developed at ETH Zurich and are based on more than ten years of academic research. Exeon was awarded as one of the top three high-tech companies at the SEF 2021 and consists of an interdisciplinary team of data scientists, machine learning experts, white hat hackers, network security specialists and business professionals. Exeon is determined to become the leading NDR provider in Europe and already counts renowned companies such as PostFinance, Planzer and SWISS Airlines among its customers.


Your impact:

  • Competently lead our customers through the buying process of our future-proof Network Detection & Response Software, ExeonTrace.
  • Working closely with our pre-sales engineers to make sure customer demos and proof-of-concepts are running smoothly.
  • Collaborating with our partners to ensure a holistic offering for our customers.
  • Representing Exeon at various events and high-level customer meetings.
  • Diligently include our CRM tool into the selling process.

 

What you can expect from us:

  • Manifold opportunities to shape your profile and grow in an innovative start-up environment according to your personal strengths.
  • Working in close collaboration with and learning from our Security Experts and Data Scientists.
  • The opportunity to take over responsibilities quickly and help shape a cutting-edge security software.
  • A high degree of trust, flexibility and independence.
  • A challenging, exciting and impactful job in an expanding Swiss company and high market potential.
  • Many freedoms in terms of working hours and place of work.
  • A young, diverse and very dynamic international team.
  • A competitive salary.

What you offer:

 

 

  • A proactive sales personality with a strong background in cyber security and knowledge of network security concepts and practices.
  • An Account Executive with proven acquisition and closing talent.
  • An enthusiastic personality with high competence, winning appearance, and an independent way of working.
  • A "networker" with a convincing appearance with major customers in German and English. French is a plus but not a must.
